Title: Leading Innovator in SAP and AS400 Development - Sukumar Bisetty
Source: India News, Breaking News, Entertainment News | India.com
Summary:
In the world of information technology, the need for skilled professionals who can seamlessly navigate complex systems is more crucial than ever. Sukumar Bisetty, a seasoned AS400 Developer and SAP Functional Analyst brings 18 years of extensive experience in the IT sector. His unique blend of technical skills and strategic insight makes him a significant asset in driving successful project implementations.

Q.1: Can you describe your professional background and how you entered the IT field?

A: My career in IT began with a strong educational foundation. I hold a master's in computer applications and a bachelor's in computer science. My journey into the IT field was fueled by a strong curiosity about technology and a passion for tackling complex challenges. I was drawn to the opportunity to create impactful solutions, and I find it highly rewarding to drive meaningful results through problem-solving and innovation. I began my professional career specializing in IBM i technology (AS/400), where I developed expertise in programming languages such as RPG, ILE, Free-format, BPCS and COBOL. Over time, I broadened my skill set to include SAP MM, SAP Ariba consulting, and Celonis analytics, deepening my capabilities across multiple platforms and tools. Engaging with clients across a wide range of industries -- including retail, healthcare, and manufacturing -- has profoundly deepened my expertise and insight into diverse business processes. This exposure has equipped me with a nuanced understanding of industry-specific challenges and best practices, enhancing my ability to deliver tailored, impactful solutions.

A: With extensive experience in AS/400, SAP MM (Materials Management), and SAP Ariba, I bring a comprehensive understanding of these key technologies in the context of end-to-end supply chain management, procurement, and enterprise resource planning.

AS/400

Starting with IBM's AS/400 platform, my expertise spans deep knowledge of its architecture, database management, and programming languages, such as RPG and COBOL. I've utilized AS/400 to streamline operations, optimize performance, and develop custom solutions for transaction-intensive environments. Working with AS/400 has given me the foundation to manage large data sets and develop applications that are secure, scalable, and tailored to specific business needs. This skillset has allowed me to leverage AS/400 to support complex and high-volume transactions for a variety of industries, ensuring data integrity and efficient processing.

SAP MM (Materials Management)

In SAP MM, I specialize in functional aspects, including procurement, inventory management, and materials planning. I have designed and implemented procurement processes tailored to unique industry requirements, streamlined inventory control, and optimized materials planning workflows. My experience with SAP MM also includes configuration and troubleshooting, helping businesses integrate SAP MM into their operations seamlessly. My knowledge spans purchase requisitions, purchase orders, goods receipts, invoice verification, and inventory postings. I'm adept at designing solutions for accurate materials data, real-time stock insights, and robust supplier relationship management, which are crucial for effective supply chain management.

SAP Ariba

As an SAP Ariba consultant, I'm skilled in sourcing, procurement, and supplier management within the Ariba platform. I have facilitated clients in implementing Ariba solutions that allow for streamlined procurement processes, efficient supplier collaboration, and improved sourcing capabilities. My work in Ariba includes designing sourcing events, enabling contract management, and configuring catalogs and procurement workflows. This expertise allows organizations to achieve cost savings, enhance compliance, and improve supplier transparency. Additionally, I've worked on spend analysis, leveraging Ariba's reporting capabilities to drive informed, strategic purchasing decisions.

Through these technologies, I have supported clients across multiple industries -- retail, healthcare, and manufacturing -- by delivering tailored solutions that enhance operational efficiency, optimize procurement processes, and strengthen supplier management, which are essential in today's competitive market.

Q.3: Could you elaborate on your experience with SAP implementation?

A: My experience with SAP implementation has spanned several projects across different modules and industries, focusing on optimizing business processes and ensuring seamless integration with existing systems. Here's an outline of my expertise in SAP implementation:

Project Preparation and Blueprinting

In the initial phases, I work closely with stakeholders to identify project goals, establish a project plan, and define the scope of work. During the blueprinting stage, I conduct workshops with end-users and key stakeholders to understand the existing processes, gather requirements, and outline the specific SAP functionalities that will best align with the organization's goals. This foundational work sets up a clear roadmap for a successful implementation, with attention to regulatory compliance, industry standards, and client-specific needs.

Configuration and Customization (SAP MM and SAP Ariba)

I am highly experienced in configuring SAP modules such as Materials Management (SAP MM) and SAP Ariba for sourcing and procurement. For SAP MM, my configuration work includes inventory management, procurement processes, and invoice verification. In SAP Ariba, I set up sourcing events, supplier registration workflows, and contract management. Where necessary, I customize workflows and document formats to ensure that all components fit seamlessly into the client's existing processes, balancing out-of-the-box functionality with custom development.

Data Migration and Integration

During SAP implementations, I have managed data migration processes, ensuring the accuracy and consistency of data between legacy systems and SAP. This involves designing data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) protocols, using tools like LTMC and custom ABAP programs to cleanse, migrate, and verify large volumes of transactional and master data. I also have experience with integrating SAP systems with external applications, such as logistics, third-party ERPs, and external procurement platforms, to provide a holistic data flow across systems.

Testing, Training, and Go-Live Support

A significant part of my role involves rigorous testing of the configured SAP solution, including unit testing, integration testing, and user acceptance testing (UAT). I create detailed test scripts and involve end-users in the UAT phase to ensure all functionalities perform as expected and meet the business requirements. Additionally, I lead training sessions and develop documentation for end-users and administrators to ensure that they are comfortable and proficient with the new system before going live. I provide go-live support to address any issues in real-time and to ensure a smooth transition with minimal disruption to business operations.

Post-Go-Live Support and Continuous Improvement

Post-implementation, I remain involved in support and optimization activities, addressing user concerns, troubleshooting issues, and applying adjustments based on end-user feedback. I also conduct periodic reviews to identify areas for further enhancement, implement additional features, and keep the system aligned with evolving business needs. My continuous improvement efforts are geared toward maintaining the long-term value and relevance of the SAP solution within the client's operations.

Cross-Industry Experience

Throughout my SAP implementation projects, I have worked across various industries, such as retail, manufacturing, and healthcare, each of which has unique operational needs and compliance standards. This diverse background allows me to bring an adaptable, informed perspective to each project, applying industry-specific insights to deliver solutions that support growth, compliance, and competitive advantage.

In summary, my SAP implementation experience is comprehensive, covering the entire project lifecycle from planning and design to post-go-live support. My focus is on creating scalable, efficient, and user-friendly SAP systems that empower clients to streamline their processes, achieve greater visibility, and make data-driven decisions.

Q.4: How do you ensure effective project management and team collaboration?

A: Ensuring effective project management and team collaboration requires a combination of clear communication, strategic planning, and leveraging the right tools and practices. Here's how I approach it:

Establish well-defined project objectives and ensure alignment with organizational goals.

Break down the project into manageable phases with milestones to track progress effectively.

Clearly communicate roles, responsibilities, and expectations to all team members.

Develop a comprehensive project plan, incorporating timelines, resources, and risk assessments.

Utilize agile methodologies or traditional project management frameworks based on the project requirements. Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess project health and progress.

Foster a culture of regular and open communication through stand-up meetings, progress updates, and collaborative tools. Utilize communication platforms like Microsoft Teams, Slack, or SAP Collaboration tools to ensure all stakeholders remain informed.

Use project management tools like Jira, Trello, or SAP Project Systems to track tasks, assign responsibilities, and manage timelines. Encourage the use of document-sharing platforms for real-time collaboration on deliverables.

Provide continuous feedback and recognition to motivate the team. Involve team members in decision-making processes to encourage participation and ownership. Address conflicts promptly and ensure a supportive environment for collaboration.

Identify potential risks early and develop mitigation plans. Regularly review and adjust strategies to address challenges and unforeseen issues.

Conduct post-project reviews to evaluate outcomes, understand challenges, and document lessons learned. Share feedback across the team to improve processes for future projects.

By combining these approaches, I ensure that projects are delivered successfully while fostering a collaborative and high-performing team environment.

Q.5: What testing methodologies do you employ to maintain quality assurance?

A: Quality assurance is a critical aspect of my work. I develop comprehensive test scenarios and test cases based on the requirements and design documents. By clearly defining the testing strategy, scope, and roles, I ensure that all potential risks are addressed. I lead User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and regression testing to guarantee that all deliverables meet the highest quality standards before they go live. This proactive approach to testing significantly reduces post-deployment issues.

Q.6: How do you approach training and supporting end-users during implementation?

A: Training and supporting end-users during implementation is a critical part of ensuring the success and adoption of any system or process. My approach involves the following steps:

Assessment: Begin by analyzing the end-users' current skill levels and understanding their specific roles and responsibilities. Customization: Tailor training materials and approaches to meet the unique needs of various user groups, such as power users, casual users, or administrators.

Structured Training: Design a detailed training plan that includes initial orientation, system demonstrations, hands-on exercises, and Q&A sessions. Modular Approach: Break training into manageable modules that cover key functionalities and workflows, starting with the basics and progressing to advanced features. Role-Specific Content: Create role-specific training materials to ensure relevance for each user group.

Live Sessions: Conduct instructor-led sessions, both in-person and virtual, to provide direct guidance and real-time interaction.

Hands-On Practice: Offer sandbox environments where users can practice tasks without impacting live data. Documentation: Provide detailed user manuals, quick reference guides, and video tutorials for self-paced learning.

Helpdesk and Support Teams: Establish a dedicated support channel, such as a helpdesk or ticketing system, to address user queries and resolve issues. Super User Network: Train and empower a group of "super users" within the organization who can act as their teams' first point of contact. On-the-Job Assistance: Offer floor-walking or shadowing sessions post-go-live to provide real-time support and answer questions.

By combining thorough preparation, targeted training, and robust ongoing support, I ensure end-users are confident and competent in using the new system, ultimately driving a smooth implementation and successful adoption.

Q.7: Can you discuss your experience with vendor management and procurement processes?

A: Vendor management and procurement have been key aspects of my professional experience, particularly in roles involving SAP MM (Materials Management) and SAP Ariba. Here's a detailed overview of my approach and expertise in these areas:

Vendor Qualification: I have participated in the end-to-end process of identifying and qualifying vendors based on company requirements, including compliance with quality, pricing, and delivery standards.

RFP/RFQ Management: Utilizing SAP Ariba Sourcing, I've facilitated creating and managing Request for Proposal (RFP) and Request for Quotation (RFQ) processes, ensuring transparency and competitiveness.

Performance Analysis: Leveraged tools like vendor scorecards to evaluate vendor performance on key metrics such as delivery timelines, quality standards, and cost-effectiveness.

Collaborative Negotiations: Worked closely with cross-functional teams, including legal and finance, to negotiate contracts that align with business goals while maintaining compliance with regulatory requirements.

Contract Management in Ariba: Used Ariba Contract Management to streamline the contract creation, approval, and renewal processes. This has improved visibility and ensured timely renewals and amendments.

Purchase Requisitions and Orders: Proficient in managing procurement cycles, including creation and approval of purchase requisitions, purchase orders (POs), and goods receipts in SAP MM.

Consignment and Subcontracting: Hands-on experience in advanced procurement scenarios like consignment procurement and subcontracting, ensuring optimal inventory levels and cost control.

Automated Workflows: Set up automated workflows for procurement approvals in SAP Ariba, reducing cycle times and ensuring adherence to organizational policies.

Proactive Communication: Maintained strong relationships with vendors by fostering open communication and collaboration, addressing concerns promptly, and ensuring alignment with business needs.

Conflict Resolution: Successfully mediated disputes related to delivery timelines, payment terms, and quality issues, ensuring continuity of supply and minimal disruptions.

Strategic Partnerships: Identified opportunities to establish long-term partnerships with key vendors, leveraging economies of scale and enhancing mutual value.

SAP Ariba Integration: Implemented and optimized Ariba modules for sourcing, procurement, and contract management, improving process efficiency and data accuracy.

Spend Analysis: Utilized Ariba Spend Analysis to identify savings opportunities, streamline vendor portfolios, and align spending with business objectives.

Process Standardization: Established standardized procurement processes across multiple business units, ensuring compliance and reducing maverick spending.

Regulatory Adherence: Ensured all procurement activities complied with internal policies and external regulations, including tax codes and supplier diversity requirements.

Risk Mitigation: Conducted regular risk assessments of vendor portfolios, including financial stability and geopolitical factors, to preempt potential disruptions.

Key Achievements

Achieved significant cost savings by consolidating vendor portfolios and negotiating favorable terms.

Reduced procurement cycle times by implementing automated workflows and optimizing vendor management processes. Improved vendor compliance and performance through structured evaluation and feedback mechanisms.

This experience has given me a comprehensive understanding of vendor management and procurement, enabling me to drive efficiency, cost savings, and strong vendor relationships while ensuring alignment with business goals.

Q.8: How do you address compliance and regulatory challenges in your projects?

A: Navigating compliance and regulatory challenges is a critical aspect of my work, especially in FDA-regulated environments. I ensure that all documentation and processes adhere to strict regulatory standards. I conduct regular training sessions for team members to keep them informed about compliance requirements. Moreover, I stay engaged in post-implementation support to promptly address any issues that arise, ensuring that all operations remain compliant.

Addressing compliance and regulatory challenges is a critical component of my approach to managing projects. Ensuring that all processes and deliverables align with internal policies, industry standards, and regulatory requirements is essential for mitigating risks and maintaining organizational integrity. Here's how I handle compliance and regulatory challenges:

Research and Awareness: I make it a priority to stay updated on relevant regulations, standards, and compliance requirements applicable to the project, whether they pertain to data privacy (e.g., GDPR, CCPA), financial reporting, or industry-specific standards.

Industry-Specific Knowledge: In industries like manufacturing, healthcare, and retail, I ensure that projects comply with industry-specific mandates, such as ISO standards or FDA requirements.

Compliance Planning: During the project initiation phase, I incorporate compliance requirements into the project plan to avoid last-minute disruptions. Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with legal, audit, and compliance teams to align on expectations and requirements early in the project lifecycle.

Policy-Adherence Frameworks: Implement standardized processes and workflows in systems like SAP MM and SAP Ariba to ensure adherence to procurement policies, tax codes, and ethical sourcing requirements. Auditable Processes: Design workflows that create traceable records, facilitating internal and external audits.

Team Enablement: Conduct regular training sessions for project teams and stakeholders to ensure they understand regulatory requirements and how they impact day-to-day operations.

Policy Documentation: Maintain clear, accessible documentation of compliance policies and procedures for reference during the project.

Automation for Compliance: Utilize tools like SAP GRC (Governance, Risk, and Compliance) and SAP Ariba Contract Management to automate compliance checks, monitor risk, and ensure adherence to contractual and regulatory obligations.

Data Protection: Ensure data privacy and security measures are in place, such as encryption, access controls, and regular audits.

Proactive Risk Assessment: Identify potential compliance risks early through thorough risk assessments, addressing issues before they escalate. Scenario Planning: Develop contingency plans to handle non-compliance scenarios, such as penalties or operational disruptions.

Regular Audits: Conduct periodic audits to ensure ongoing compliance and identify areas for improvement.

Feedback Loops: Create mechanisms to gather feedback from stakeholders on compliance-related challenges, enabling continuous process refinement.

Examples of Implementation

Procurement Compliance: While implementing SAP Ariba, I ensured that supplier registration processes adhered to tax regulations and ethical sourcing policies.

Data Privacy: For projects involving customer or vendor data, I incorporated GDPR-compliant practices into workflows, including data anonymization and consent management.

Contractual Adherence: In contract management, I set up validation rules in Ariba to flag non-compliance with terms, preventing unauthorized changes or extensions.

Key Achievements

Reduced compliance-related risks by integrating automated checks into procurement and financial workflows. Achieved audit readiness for multiple projects by maintaining detailed records and ensuring process transparency. Built cross-functional alignment on compliance goals, fostering a culture of accountability and adherence.

This structured approach not only ensures compliance but also builds trust with stakeholders and regulators, safeguarding the organization against potential risks.

Q.9: What have been some of your significant achievements in your career?

A: Throughout my career, I have had the privilege of contributing to impactful projects and achieving milestones that have added significant value to organizations and teams. Here are some of my key achievements:

Streamlined Procurement Processes: Led end-to-end implementation of SAP MM for a global manufacturing company, automating procurement workflows, improving vendor management efficiency, and reducing cycle times by 30%.

SAP Ariba Rollout: Spearheaded the deployment of SAP Ariba for sourcing and contract management across multiple regions, ensuring seamless integration with existing ERP systems, improving spend visibility, and driving savings in procurement.

Cross-Functional Collaboration: Worked with stakeholders across finance, procurement, and IT to standardize procurement processes across 10+ plants, reducing inconsistencies and ensuring regulatory compliance.

Cost Reduction Initiatives: Conducted a detailed spend analysis using SAP Ariba Spend Analysis, identifying cost-saving opportunities that reduced procurement costs by 15% within a year.

Inventory Optimization: Implemented inventory control measures using SAP MM, reducing carrying costs by 20% while maintaining optimal stock levels.

Automated Vendor Onboarding: Designed and implemented a supplier registration process in SAP Ariba, reducing onboarding time by 50% and enhancing vendor compliance with organizational standards.

Improved Data Accuracy: Leveraged Celonis for process mining, identifying bottlenecks in order-to-cash workflows, and reducing errors by 40% through targeted interventions.

Resolution of Costing Issues: Resolved complex cost-update discrepancies between CAMS and SAP systems, ensuring accurate financial postings across multiple plants.

Improved Material Management: Developed a system to validate and automate material extensions across plants, saving significant time and ensuring data integrity.

Mentorship and Training: Trained teams on SAP MM and SAP Ariba, enabling faster adoption of new systems and processes. My efforts helped reduce the learning curve and improve system utilization.

Cross-Department Projects: Led multi-functional teams to implement process changes that improved alignment between procurement, finance, and operations.

Regulatory Compliance: Established compliance workflows in SAP MM and SAP Ariba, ensuring adherence to tax regulations, data privacy laws (GDPR), and ethical sourcing standards.

Audit Success: Enabled successful audits by implementing traceable and transparent procurement and financial processes.

Spend Visibility Enhancement: Developed dashboards and reporting tools for spend analysis, providing leadership with actionable insights to make informed strategic decisions.

Vendor Performance Management: Designed metrics and dashboards in SAP Ariba to measure and improve vendor performance, enhancing supplier relationships and delivery quality.

Recognition and Impact

Earned the Best Process Innovator Award for redesigning procurement workflows, achieving both cost savings and process efficiency. Recognized by leadership for my contributions to key projects, including a large-scale SAP migration that was completed ahead of schedule and within budget.

These achievements reflect my commitment to delivering value through expertise in SAP, problem-solving, and collaboration, driving both operational excellence and strategic growth.

Q.10: How do you see the future of technology impacting your field?

A: The future of technology is poised to transform the fields of IT, procurement, and supply chain management in profound ways. Here's how I envision it impacting my area of expertise:

AI and Machine Learning: Technologies like predictive analytics and AI will enable organizations to anticipate demand, optimize procurement strategies, and reduce waste. For instance, procurement platforms such as SAP Ariba and tools like Celonis will increasingly use AI to identify patterns, risks, and opportunities in real time.

Advanced Spend Analytics: With more sophisticated analytics tools, organizations will gain deeper insights into spending behavior, enabling strategic sourcing and better cost control.

Robotic Process Automation (RPA): RPA will automate routine tasks such as purchase order creation, invoice processing, and vendor onboarding, freeing up teams to focus on strategic activities.

Smart Contracts and Blockchain: Blockchain technology will likely redefine vendor relationships and contract management by providing secure, transparent, and automated processes for executing agreements.

Scalable Systems: Cloud-based ERP and procurement solutions like SAP Ariba will continue to dominate, allowing organizations to scale operations quickly and access data globally.

Remote Work Enablement: Tools for collaboration, such as Teams and Ariba Network, will integrate more deeply with ERP systems, enabling seamless remote operations and decision-making.

Green Procurement: Technology will play a vital role in tracking and reporting on the environmental impact of procurement decisions, encouraging more sustainable sourcing practices.

Circular Economy Tools: Solutions will emerge to support the circular economy, ensuring products are reused, recycled, or remanufactured efficiently.

IoT and Real-Time Monitoring: The Internet of Things (IoT) will enable better tracking of inventory and shipments, leading to improved inventory accuracy and reduced transit times.

Dynamic Pricing Models: With advanced forecasting tools, companies will adjust procurement strategies dynamically based on market trends, ensuring cost-effectiveness.

As technology advances, the need for robust cybersecurity in procurement systems will grow. Tools that monitor and protect sensitive vendor and financial data will become indispensable.

Intuitive Interfaces: Platforms like SAP will prioritize user-friendly experiences, integrating AI-driven assistants to guide users through processes.

Tailored Solutions: Customizable procurement and ERP systems will adapt to the unique needs of industries and businesses, offering greater flexibility.

Global Vendor Networks: Platforms like SAP Ariba will continue to expand, fostering greater collaboration across global supply chains and enhancing transparency and accountability.

Conclusion

The intersection of technology with procurement and IT will result in more innovative, faster, and more sustainable processes. By staying at the forefront of these advancements, professionals can drive strategic value for their organizations, ensuring adaptation and leadership in a rapidly changing environment.

About Sukumar Bisetty

Sukumar Bisetty is an IT professional with 18 years of experience specializing in AS400 development, SAP MM functional analysis and SAP Ariba consulting. He has a robust track record of designing, implementing, and supporting complex IT solutions, with a strong focus on SAP and FDA-regulated environments. Sukumar is adept at using RICEF methodology to convert user requirements into functional specifications and has extensive experience in SAP configuration for procurement processes, vendor evaluation, and material management.

His domain expertise spans healthcare, retail, manufacturing, and finance, where he has delivered key solutions in system integration, process automation, and data migration. Sukumar is proficient in legacy technologies like RPG, CL, and DB2, while also leveraging modern tools such as SAP Charm, Celonis, and HANA for business process optimization. He is a proven leader in managing cross-functional teams, collaborating with stakeholders, and delivering high-quality solutions across a variety of industries.

Sukumar Bisetty is a seasoned IT professional with extensive expertise in enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems, supply chain management, and procurement solutions. With a career spanning over a decade, he has developed a strong foundation in AS/400 systems, SAP MM (Materials Management), and SAP Ariba consulting. His diverse experience across manufacturing, retail, and healthcare industries has honed his ability to optimize business processes and deliver impactful technology solutions.

Expertise in procurement, vendor management, and sourcing processes using SAP solutions.

Proven track record in implementing SAP Ariba for spend analysis, contract management, and e-auctions.

AS/400 Systems

In-depth knowledge of RPG and COBOL programming languages, enabling efficient system design and customization and streamlining legacy systems to integrate with modern ERP solutions.

Process Optimization and Automation

Driving efficiency through advanced tools like Celonis for process mining and automation. Implementing RPA and AI-powered solutions to reduce manual efforts and enhance productivity.

Data-Driven Insights

Leveraging spend analytics to uncover cost-saving opportunities and strategic sourcing decisions.

Utilizing business intelligence tools to align procurement with organizational goals.

Cross-Functional Collaboration

Successfully partnering with IT, finance, and operational teams to ensure smooth ERP implementations and upgrades. Strong leadership in training and supporting end-users to maximize system adoption.

Professional Highlights

Global SAP Implementation: Led large-scale SAP implementations and rollouts, ensuring alignment with business goals.

Vendor Management Expertise: Delivered seamless vendor onboarding and procurement processes across complex supply chains.

Innovative Solutions: Championed digital transformation initiatives, including adopting cloud-based tools and automation technologies.

Vision

Sukumar is passionate about leveraging technology to create efficient, resilient, and future-ready business processes. He aims to drive innovation and strategic value for organizations worldwide by staying at the forefront of industry trends.

Title: Lamps Plus AI-enables omnichannel forecasting
Summary:
Lamps Plus is leveraging artificial intelligence to improve forecasting and visibility into replenishment cycles.

The regional West Coast specialty lighting retailer is deploying the Manhattan Associates demand forecasting and inventory optimization (DFIO) solution to upgrade its demand forecasting and inventory management capabilities as part of an ongoing technology modernization effort.

Lamps Plus built upon an existing partnership with Manhattan Associates to implement the AI- and machine learning-based DFIO solution, as well as the vendor's POS, store inventory & fulfillment, order management, warehouse management, labor management, and slotting optimization, as part of a broader enterprise modernization effort.

[READ MORE: How Brooks Bros., Floor & Décor, Lamps Plus use advanced planning]

"Given the complexity and interdependence of demand forecasting and inventory management, and the critical importance of getting it right, we knew our legacy approach was no longer adequate to serve our business needs," said Bill Gratke, chief supply chain officer at Lamps Plus. "This implementation was among the smoothest we've experienced, completed flawlessly in under six months."

How Lamps Plus will utilize DFIO

Lamps Plus has implemented the Manhattan Associates DFIO solution at its West Coast fulfillment center that serves its e-commerce channel as well as its 31 stores. A second hub on the East Coast will go live in the first half of 2025.

Title: Lamps Plus Partners with Manhattan to Improve Demand Forecasting, Inventory Accuracy
Summary:
Manhattan Associates Inc. (NASDAQ: MANH) announced today that Lamps Plus, the nation's leading specialty lighting retailer, has implemented Manhattan's Demand Forecasting and Inventory Optimization solution (DFIO) to improve forecast accuracy and visibility into replenishment cycles while maintaining demanding customer expectations.

Needing to upgrade its demand forecasting and inventory management capabilities, Lamps Plus selected Manhattan as part of an ongoing technology modernization effort. A longtime partner of Lamps Plus, Manhattan was the logical choice to expand its footprint with its best-in-class solution that harnesses the power of data analytics, machine learning and artificial intelligence to deliver unmatched forecast accuracy, even in the most complex and dynamic scenarios.

"Given the complexity and interdependence of demand forecasting and inventory management, and the critical importance of getting it right, we knew our legacy approach was no longer adequate to serve our business needs," said Bill Gratke, chief supply chain officer at Lamps Plus. "Through our 17-year relationship with Manhattan, they've delivered time and again, which made this decision that much easier. This implementation was among the smoothest we've experienced, completed flawlessly in under six months."

In addition to Demand Forecasting and Inventory Optimization, Lamps Plus has implemented Manhattan Active ® Point of Sale, Store Inventory & Fulfillment, Order Management, Warehouse Management, Labor Management, and Slotting Optimization.

Lamps Plus has implemented Manhattan's DFIO solution at its West Coast fulfillment center (FC) that serves its ecommerce channel as well as its 31 stores. A second FC on the East Coast will go live in the first half of 2025. It includes Manhattan's Unified Forecasting Method, advanced statistical modeling designed to ensure the ideal state of "right inventory, right place, right time," all the time.

As seasonality is a major factor in Lamps Plus's business, Manhattan's DFIO solution builds simulations that model the impact of seasonal demand on forecast accuracy before profiles are updated. With the improved forecast accuracy, Lamps Plus can confidently place orders months in advance to replenish stocks in late Q1/early Q2 2025, after the Chinese New Year vendor shutdown period.

Ecommerce represents a significant portion of Lamps Plus sales, and the company uses a shared inventory pool approach. With DFIO live at the FCs, Lamps Plus will be able to meet or exceed its fulfillment service levels while running leaner on inventory, saving on carrying costs and other operational expenses.

"We've had a long and successful partnership with Lamps Plus, including many successful transformational software projects," said Stewart Gantt, executive vice president, Professional Services at Manhattan Associates. "With the addition of our DFIO solution, this leading retailer has improved its forecasting, providing significant gains in inventory segmentation and available to commerce (ATC) visibility."

About Lamps Plus

Established in 1976 and headquartered in Los Angeles, Lamps Plus is the nation's largest specialty lighting retailer, operating a thriving e-commerce business, LampsPlus.com, along with 35 stores in the western United States. Lamps Plus carries a full range of lighting and home furnishings, including exclusive patented designs and artisan-made customizable shades and lamps. The company's American Lighting Association-trained staff provides expert advice. Follow @LampsPlus on social media: Instagram, Pinterest, YouTube, Facebook, TikTok, and X (formerly Twitter). To learn more about the history of the company, visit our About Us page.

About Manhattan Associates

Manhattan Associates is a global technology leader in supply chain and omnichannel commerce. We unite information across the enterprise, converging front-end sales with back-end supply chain execution. Our software, platform technology and unmatched experience help drive both top-line growth and bottom-line profitability for our customers.

Manhattan Associates designs, builds and delivers leading edge cloud and on-premises solutions so that across the store, through your network or from your fulfillment center, you are ready to reap the rewards of the omnichannel marketplace. For more information, please visit www.manh.com.

Title: SAP BrandVoice: Santa's Sleigh: A High-Tech Marvel That Means Business
Summary:
Ever wondered what makes Santa's sleigh the envy of every tech mogul?

Buckle up, because we're diving into the magical, high-tech world of Santa's sleigh -- an engineering marvel that requires meticulous care and maintenance to ensure a smooth ride on Christmas Eve.

Forget your traditional wooden sleigh; Santa's ride is a polymorphic alloy masterpiece. This bad boy is lighter than a feather and tougher than the wild turkeys strutting outside my window the day before Thanksgiving. With a ceramic coating that could rival NASA's space shuttle, this sleigh is built to withstand the extreme temperatures of flying faster than the speed of light.

He also makes sure that he leverages the latest technologies such as the estimated thousand plus IoT sensors to measure to create a digital twin of the sleigh. This ensures that the elves in Christmas Central have a real-time view, of how it is performing on Christmas Eve.

And let's talk power! Santa's sleigh is powered by "eight tiny reindeer", each one trained like an Olympic athlete. But that's not all -- Rudolph isn't just the leader because of his shiny nose; he's also the sleigh's built-in GPS! Who needs Google Maps when you have a reindeer with a glowing red beacon guiding the way?

I also hear that this year, Santa is leveraging a digital co-pilot that leverages AI to optimize route planning in real time.

With this tech, Santa can focus on what really matters -- delivering joy and the smiles on the faces of "children of all ages"!

Behind every successful sleigh ride is a dedicated team of elves working tirelessly in Santa's workshop. These little helpers are akin to pit crew members at a Formula One race, ensuring that everything runs smoothly. Equipped with mobile devices, they check everything from sleigh runners to Rudolph's harness, making sure everything is in tip-top shape.

In preparation for Christmas Eve, Santa disperses his "little helpers" to strategically located Maintenance and Distribution Centers worldwide. These centers leverage inventory optimization strategies and the latest collaboration tools to ensure that they are stocked with the right spare parts and gifts, ready to be deployed at a moment's notice. If something goes wrong mid-flight -- like a reindeer getting tired or a sleigh malfunctioning -- these elves are ready to jump in faster than you can say "Ho Ho Ho!"

EHS (Elf health and safety) is paramount at the North Pole. The elves undergo rigorous training to ensure they're ready for anything -- like dodging rogue drones delivering holiday packages or managing last-minute gift requests. And let's not forget about the reindeer! They receive regular health checks to ensure they're fit for duty. If one gets tired, another can swoop in to save the day -- talk about teamwork!

This year, Santa has taken things up a notch with AI technology that would make Tony Stark proud.

Imagine an AI system that monitors how much energy (or magic) each reindeer contributes during flight! This system helps Santa optimize his team for maximum efficiency, ensuring Rudolph and his friends are fueled up and ready to go without running low on magic mid-flight.

Santa can even change his route on the fly based on weather patterns or last-minute naughty and nice list updates -- all thanks to predictive analytics and AI-driven decision-making. With this tech-savvy approach, Santa can deliver presents faster than you can say "Jingle Bells."

Thanks to those estimated thousand-plus IoT sensors installed throughout the sleigh, Christmas Central can monitor Santa's progress in real time. If the sleigh is malfunctioning, or a part is predicted to fail, those elves will spring into action. They'll send him a quick message: "Hey Santa, take a left at Greenland and head in for a running repairs!"

So, there you have it! Behind every jingle bell you hear on Christmas Eve is not just holiday magic but also an incredibly sophisticated operation that combines engineering marvels with high-tech wizardry. With careful planning, advanced technology, and a dedicated team of elves and reindeer, Santa's sleigh is ready for action every Christmas Eve.

Next time you hear those jingle bells ringing through the night sky, remember that it's not just Santa flying through the air -- it's a well-oiled machine (or rather, a well-maintained sleigh) making its way around the globe.

So as you cozy up by the fire this holiday season, raise a glass of eggnog to Santa and his high-tech sleigh -- because nothing says "Merry Christmas, and to all a good night" quite like an AI-optimized ride through the night sky!

Title: Top 10 Innovative Warehousing Solutions Providers In India 2025 - Inventiva
Summary:
In an era where seamless logistics and supply chain operations are paramount, warehousing has emerged as a cornerstone of efficient business management. With India experiencing a surge in e-commerce, retail, and manufacturing, the demand for advanced warehousing solutions has skyrocketed. This blog highlights the top 10 best warehousing solutions providers in India for 2025, each excelling in offering reliable, scalable, and tech-driven services tailored to modern business needs.

Warehousing is not just about storage; it is about optimizing supply chain operations. Effective warehousing solutions ensure streamlined inventory management, faster deliveries, and reduced operational costs.

In India, where industries range from traditional manufacturing to booming e-commerce, warehousing plays a pivotal role in maintaining competitive advantage. Modern warehousing solutions providers integrate technology, sustainability, and flexibility to meet the evolving needs of businesses.

A global leader in logistics, DHL Supply Chain India excels in offering state-of-the-art warehousing solutions. With cutting-edge facilities and advanced technologies like robotics and AI, DHL ensures seamless inventory management and quick order fulfillment.

Mahindra Logistics stands out for its customer-centric approach and technology-driven warehousing services. It specializes in providing scalable solutions for industries like automotive, e-commerce, and FMCG, ensuring cost efficiency and reliability.

Known for its robust logistics network, Delhivery offers integrated warehousing solutions designed for flexibility and scalability. The company leverages automation and predictive analytics to optimize storage and distribution.

Blue Dart is a trusted name in the logistics industry, offering comprehensive warehousing services that cater to various sectors, including healthcare and retail. Its focus on real-time tracking and security makes it a preferred choice for businesses.

Future Supply Chain Solutions provides customized warehousing and distribution services. Its use of technology to enhance storage capacity and streamline operations has made it a significant player in the warehousing solutions provider industry.

Specializing in cold chain warehousing, Snowman Logistics is the go-to provider for industries requiring temperature-controlled storage. Its advanced cold storage facilities ensure the safe handling of perishable goods.

TCI offers integrated warehousing services, focusing on efficiency and cost-effectiveness. With a vast network and advanced IT systems, it provides end-to-end supply chain solutions tailored to client needs.

Gati-KWE delivers warehousing solutions that emphasize speed and reliability. The company's focus on real-time monitoring and data-driven decision-making ensures optimal inventory management.

Allcargo Logistics is renowned for its extensive warehousing facilities across India. It combines technology with sustainability to provide eco-friendly solutions for storage and distribution.

A leader in warehousing solutions providers, Godrej Storage Solutions offers automated and modular storage systems. Its focus on optimizing space and enhancing operational efficiency sets it apart in the competitive market.

The success of these warehouse solutions provider companies lies in their ability to integrate the following features into their services:

Automation, robotics, and IoT are transforming warehousing by enabling real-time tracking, predictive analytics, and inventory optimization.

Many providers are adopting eco-friendly practices such as energy-efficient facilities and green logistics to align with global environmental standards.

Flexibility to expand or adapt storage capacities based on business growth and market demands is a critical offering by these companies.

Tailoring services to meet specific industry requirements ensures that clients receive maximum value from their warehousing investments.

From storage to distribution, integrated solutions streamline supply chain operations and enhance overall efficiency.

India's warehousing solutions provider is evolving rapidly, driven by the following trends:

As India's economy grows, so does the complexity of supply chains. Warehousing solutions providers play a crucial role in ensuring that businesses remain competitive. By adopting the latest technologies, focusing on sustainability, and offering customized solutions, these companies are setting new benchmarks in operational excellence.

The growth of sectors such as e-commerce, healthcare, and manufacturing will continue to drive demand for advanced warehousing solutions. Companies that innovate and invest in resilient infrastructure will lead the way in shaping the future of logistics and supply chain management.

The top 10 warehousing solutions provider in India for 2025 have demonstrated their commitment to innovation, efficiency, and customer satisfaction. Whether it's through automation, sustainability, or industry-specific solutions, these companies are helping businesses thrive in a competitive market.

Title: How digital strategy of Ulta Beauty drives customer engagement - InfotechLead
Summary:
Ulta Beauty's digital strategy focuses on creating an integrated, innovative, and personalized experience that strengthens customer engagement, drives e-commerce growth, and enhances omnichannel synergies.

Ulta Beauty says its sales grew 1.7 percent to $2.53 billion in Q3 2024, primarily due to new store contribution. The company is aiming to achieve sales of $11.1 billion to $11.2 billion during the current year. Its capital expenditure will be $400 million to $425 million in 2024.

Tech team at Ulta Beauty will have an option to rethink on activities as revenue of Ulta Beauty rose marginally despite making investment in digital transformation. Gross profit as a percentage of net sales fell to 39.1 percent compared to 39.7 percent, mainly due to lower merchandise margin.

Pillars of digital strategy

With 44 million active members in the Ulta Beauty Rewards program, the company harnesses customer insights to personalize product recommendations, replenish reminders, and targeted offers.

Ulta Beauty utilizes owned and paid channels for targeted lifecycle campaigns that efficiently reactivate members and foster deeper loyalty, especially among Platinum and Diamond members.

Ulta Beauty has expanded personalization across all touchpoints, including retargeting, social channels, and email, to maximize customer lifetime value.

GLAMlab 2.0 offers immersive virtual try-on tools and AI-powered skin and hair analysis, enabling guests to explore and shop products with enhanced precision, shoppable looks, and a user-friendly interface.

Ulta Beauty's digital buying guides provide educational content, beauty tips, and product recommendations to improve search engine optimization (SEO) and help customers make informed decisions.

Ulta Beauty, as part of its community building program, has launched platforms like the UB Community to foster authentic connections among beauty enthusiasts and amplify themes of beauty, wellness, and self-expression.

Ulta Beauty, as part of its mobile-first strategy, is focusing on enhancing the app adoption by offering engaging features, exclusive access to events and products, and personalized offers, contributing to over two-thirds of e-commerce sales.

Ulta Beauty's initiatives on site optimization have ensured better navigation, product pages, and search functionality to improve user experience and drive conversions.

Ulta Beauty has also expanded sampling programs by leveraging digital tools to promote trial, leading to double-digit sales growth from sampling initiatives.

Ulta Beauty utilizes UB Media to offer strategic advertising opportunities, including AI-powered non-endemic ads and beauty-centric campaigns for brands.

Ulta Beauty, as part of its plan for gaming and virtual engagement, has expanded the "Ultaverse" on Roblox, providing innovative spaces for brand engagement, virtual try-ons, and product discovery in a growing gaming community.

For seamless shopping, Ulta Beauty has strengthened connections between physical and digital experiences, offering immersive in-store events and coordinated online activations. Ulta Beauty has also utilized digital channels to promote in-store salon workshops, enhancing guest engagement and product adoption.

Implementation of advanced AI solutions is expected to drive inventory optimization, enhance search algorithms, and provide real-time insights into customer preferences.

In partnership with Rokt, Ulta Beauty has introduced AI-driven ad placements to broaden advertising scope beyond beauty, enhancing monetization opportunities.

There are plans for further AI integration to refine digital personalization and optimize backend operations, such as inventory management.

Ulta Beauty promotes exclusive offerings like the Wicked-inspired collection and Mini Brands to create buzz and draw traffic to both digital and physical platforms. It also focuses on tutorials, beauty guides, and interactive resources to inform and inspire customers.

Ulta Beauty aims to combine IT investments with merchandise fixtures to enhance digital capabilities in-store. Ulta Beauty uses digital channels to extend sampling programs and create virtual touchpoints that complement the in-store experience.

Capital investments are aimed at IT enhancements and advanced digital tools to scale operations effectively. Ulta Beauty will align digital investments with omnichannel strategies to maximize operating margins while scaling e-commerce capabilities.

Ulta Beauty's digital strategy seamlessly integrates innovation, personalization, and community engagement to deliver a distinctive, connected, and rewarding experience for customers. By leveraging technology and customer insights, Ulta continues to lead in the beauty retail space while driving sustainable growth.

Title: Kroger digital strategies drive e-commerce and customer loyalty - InfotechLead
Summary:
Kroger CEO has explained how it serves over 11 million customers daily by offering better digital shopping experience and retail food stores with the support of 420,000 associates.

Kroger is enhancing customer experience, making investment in digital technology for operational efficiency, and expanding revenue opportunities through personalized services and proprietary offerings.

Kroger's digital performance was supported by 18 percent rise in delivery sales led by Customer Fulfillment Centers. Kroger also improved pickup productivity to a record low cost per order supported by the addition of order batching and routing technology in stores.

Kroger has also enhanced the Boost by Kroger Plus Membership by including Disney streaming options streaming options with an annual membership. Kroger has reported revenue of $33.6 billion and gross margin of 22.9 percent of sales for the third quarter of 2024. Kroger is aiming for capital expenditure of $3.6 billion - $3.8 billion in 2024.

"Kroger achieved strong sales results in the third quarter led by our pharmacy and digital performance, which reflects the strength and diversity of our model," Kroger Chairman and CEO Rodney McMullen said.

Digital Strategy of Kroger

Digital sales grew by 11 percent, with delivery sales leading at 18 percent. Boost, the affordable membership program for free delivery, is driving e-commerce adoption and customer loyalty.

Kroger has achieved growth in the adoption of the Boost membership program to enhance delivery penetration. Kroger has developed targeted promotions for digital channels to attract and retain high-value customers who shop both online and in-store.

Kroger has strengthened partnerships with third-party delivery networks and customer fulfillment centers (CFCs) to optimize logistics and meet growing demand.

Digital growth impacts overall profitability due to higher costs in delivery and fulfillment. Kroger is increasing its focus on automation in customer fulfillment centers to reduce operational costs and improve efficiency.

Kroger has already introduced AI-driven tools for inventory optimization and sell-through management, focusing on fresh and center-store departments. It utilized advanced forecasting tools to better align inventory with demand, minimizing waste and improving margins.

Personalization and seamless shopping are central to Kroger's differentiated experience, driving loyalty and higher engagement. Kroger has expanded personalized offers through data-driven insights, improving relevance and savings for customers.

It integrated digital and physical shopping experiences, such as curbside pickup and in-store digital kiosks, for convenience. Kroger has utilized AI-powered personalization to suggest products based on shopping history and seasonal trends.

Kroger has made investment in retail media capabilities, offering targeted advertising opportunities to brand partners. It leveraged first-party data from digital channels to create high-impact campaigns that benefit advertisers and drive incremental revenue. Kroger has collaborated with brands to develop exclusive digital promotions tied to seasonal or trending products.

Kroger noted that innovations in technology areas such as RFID labels and AI tools are driving improvements in inventory visibility and freshness. Kroger will scale RFID technology across more categories to ensure consistent quality and reduce spoilage.

Extension in AI-powered forecasting and inventory tools will cover end-to-end supply chain operations. It uses data analytics to streamline fresh product replenishment and identify trends in customer preferences. Generative AI tools for sell-through and inventory management are enhancing productivity and freshness.

Digital offer engagement has grown by 5 percent, leading to 14 percent more savings for customers. Kroger will increase customer appreciation initiatives, such as holiday meal bundles and discounts, to strengthen brand loyalty. Kroger will focus on engaging content in digital ads, emails, and mobile apps to promote savings and exclusive offers.

The development of a strong digital strategy along with its technology partners positions Kroger as a leader in digital grocery retail.

Title: Energy Drink Firm Celsius Set to Energize Market Growth, Analyst Sees Significant Upside
Summary:
Needham analyst Gerald Pascarelli initiated coverage on Celsius Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ:CELH) with a Buy rating and a price target of $38.

The analyst says that as the third-largest player in energy drinks, CELH is positioned to benefit from a healthier category rebound and growing demand for zero-sugar products, creating a favorable environment for revenue acceleration alongside easier year-over-year comparisons.

The analyst writes that while the company recently saw its first year-over-year share loss, they are encouraged by the category's return to a high single-digit growth rate.

If this trend continues, CELH stands to benefit from a healthier market backdrop, easier comps, and upcoming innovations planned for 2025, adds the analyst.

Additionally, inventory optimization challenges appear to be resolving, which should improve alignment between sell-through and reported results.

The analyst estimates full year 2024 revenue and EPS of $1.365 billion and $0.68 and $1.548 billion and $0.93 in fiscal year 2025, respectively.

Last month, the company reported third-quarter earnings per share of $0.00, missing the street view of $0.04. Quarterly sales of $265.70 million (down 31%) missed the analyst consensus of $267.11 million.

An investor can make a few decisions when deciding whether a stock is a good buy. In addition to valuation metrics and price action which you can find on Benzinga's quote pages - like Celsius Holdings's page for example - there are factors like whether or not a company pays a dividend or buys a large portion of its stock each quarter.

These are known as capital allocation programs. Celsius Holdings does not pay a dividend, but obviously has a few ways it can return value to shareholders. Feel free to search Benzinga's dividend calendar for the next company that is due to pay a dividend and determine what kind of yield you can earn for holding a share of the company.

For example, if you're looking to earn an annualized return of 14.2%, you'll need to buy a share of Ellington Residential by the Dec. 31, 2024. Once done, you can expect to receive a nominal payout of $0.08 on Jan. 27, 2025.

Buyback programs are obviously different and highly variable. A company can approve a buyback program and purchase shares as it sees fit over the course of time in which the buyback was authorized. Looking through the latest news on Celsius Holdings will often yield whether or not the company has approved a buyback program recently. Buyback programs usually serve as a support for share prices, serving as a backstop for demand.

Title: Deepak Venkatachalam: A Seasoned Leader in Data Engineering and AI Innovation
Summary:
Deepak Venkatachalam is a distinguished Senior Data Engineer with over 17 years of experience in data engineering, AI/ML, and business intelligence across industries including pharmacy benefit management, retail, and supply chain. His career demonstrates expertise in cloud migration, advanced analytics, and scalable data solutions, making him a highly influential figure in driving innovation and efficiency in data-centric enterprises.

Mastering Data Engineering and Cloud Solutions

Deepak's career highlights a robust understanding of data integration, cloud platforms, and advanced analytics. At a major healthcare provider, he played a pivotal role in a comprehensive cloud migration for complex financial forecasting models, transitioning from Excel to Azure Databricks and significantly reducing processing times from two weeks to mere hours. This transformation empowered faster financial decisions, bolstered efficiency, and exemplified his expertise in migrating large data workloads seamlessly to cloud environments.

A proponent of hybrid cloud strategies, Deepak has also harnessed both Azure and Google Cloud (GCP) to enhance data accuracy in financial forecasting models, using tools such as ThoughtSpot, Tableau, and Looker for executive data visualization. His approach integrates multiple cloud platforms and data pipelines, enabling real-time insights that are integral to strategic decision-making in high-stakes sectors.

Revenue-Driven Innovation and Client Retention

Beyond his technical prowess, Deepak's work has directly contributed to substantial revenue generation. In his current role, he led efforts that generated over $105 billion in revenue by improving client satisfaction, enhancing forecasting accuracy, and developing customized product features. His development of a custom formulary features alone brought in forty-two additional clients and $35 billion in revenue, reinforcing his reputation as a leader who understands how to leverage data solutions for competitive advantage and customer loyalty.

Leadership and Process Optimization

Deepak's leadership extends to building and managing high-performance teams. He established a resolute operations and reporting team to provide 24/7 client support, ensuring reliable reporting services. Deepak's team management has contributed to seamless delivery and heightened operational reliability. His work in inventory optimization, vendor benchmarking, and supply chain operations generated significant savings and improved inventory efficiency by millions of dollars, exemplifying his strategic approach to resource management.

Expertise in Business Intelligence and Data Visualization

In his role as a Senior Advisor for Front Store Analytics, Deepak developed data-driven dashboards and metrics to track inventory, merchandising, and supply chain performance. His efforts led to a $200 million inventory reduction and improvements in customer-focused inventory management, significantly impacting profitability and operational efficiency. With expertise in data visualization tools like Tableau and Looker, he provides senior leaders with actionable insights to guide strategic initiatives.

Technology Mastery and Cross-Platform Proficiency

Deepak's technical expertise spans Azure, Google Cloud, Snowflake, Teradata, and a range of business intelligence tools. His ability to architect solutions across cloud platforms, combined with programming skills in languages such as R, Python, SQL, and advanced PL/SQL, makes him a versatile and effective engineer. With certifications in Azure, GCP, and ThoughtSpot, Deepak remains at the forefront of technological advancement, continuously learning to stay ahead in an evolving tech landscape.

Vision for Future Data Engineering

Deepak is focused on enhancing predictive analytics, AI-driven financial forecasting, and data governance within enterprise settings. He believes that leveraging AI and automation in data engineering can drive unprecedented levels of accuracy and efficiency in business intelligence. His ongoing commitment to integrating AI and cloud solutions underscores his forward-thinking approach, setting the stage for innovations that will shape the future of data engineering.

A Legacy of Excellence in Data Solutions

Deepak Venkatachalam's career is a testament to his dedication to data innovation, strategic impact, and operational excellence. His transformative contributions to major organizations underscore his ability to balance technical proficiency with business insight. As Deepak continues to lead in data engineering, his work not only drives revenue growth but also sets a high standard for the next generation of data professionals, inspiring a future where data engineering fuels both efficiency and innovation.

Title: Celsius shares rise as Needham initiates coverage with buy rating By Investing.com
Summary:
On Friday, Celsius Holdings Inc. (NASDAQ: NASDAQ:CELH), known for its CELSIUS energy drink brand, experienced a surge of over 4% in the morning trading session. This uptick came as analysts at Needham initiated coverage on the company, bestowing a buy rating and setting a price target (PT) of $38. The firm also placed Celsius Holdings on their conviction list, signaling their high confidence in the stock's potential.

Needham's analysts highlighted a positive outlook for Celsius Holdings, despite a recent slowdown in consumer takeaway trends. They forecast brighter prospects for the company looking ahead to 2025, citing its position as the third player in the energy drink sector. The analysts pointed out the growing consumer preference for zero sugar products and a healthier category overall, which they believe will help re-accelerate the company's revenue growth.

The coverage initiation comes after a period during which Celsius Holdings' stock value declined significantly, with shares down approximately 70% from their peak. Needham analysts suggested that the current valuation is much more attractive compared to the spring of the previous year. They also noted that the company is likely to overcome inventory optimization challenges, which they expect to align sell-through rates more closely with reported results.

Needham's addition of Celsius Holdings to their conviction list implies a strong belief in the company's ability to recover and grow in the near future. The analysts emphasized that the energy drink market's healthier segment is improving after previously underperforming compared to historical growth rates. This improvement, along with easing inventory headwinds, is anticipated to lift a major overhang on the company's performance.

In summary, the analysts at Needham have a favorable view of Celsius Holdings' potential for revenue growth and market positioning. They have reset expectations for the company and believe that the stock is now positioned for a compelling valuation, setting the stage for positive developments in the coming years.

Title: Centric Software Wins Frost & Sullivan 2024 Global Technology Innovation Leadership Award for Artificial Intelligence Innovation
Summary:
CAMPBELL, Calif., Dec. 6, 2024 /PRNewswire-PRWeb/ -- Frost & Sullivan has completed their assessment of the use of artificial intelligence in the fashion and retail industry. The results have led to Centric Software® winning the 2024 Global Technology Innovation Leadership Award. Centric Software has integrated Artificial Intelligence (AI) and other innovations into the product lifecycle management (PLM) flow, extending the coverage of cutting-edge tools from product creation through to replenishment.

Centric Software has received multiple accolades from Frost & Sullivan for its leadership in innovation and growth within the PLM sector, earning awards in 2012, 2016, 2018, 2021, 2022, 2023 and now in 2024.

The Frost & Sullivan Best Practices awards are presented to companies in various regional and global markets for demonstrating outstanding achievement and superior performance in leadership, technological innovation, customer service, and strategic product development. Industry analysts compare market participants and measure performance through in-depth interviews, analyses, and extensive secondary research to identify best practices in the industry.

Centric Software provides the most innovative enterprise solutions to plan, design, develop, source, buy, make, price, allocate, sell and replenish products such as fashion, luxury, footwear, outdoor, home and related goods like cosmetics & personal care as well as multi-category retail to achieve strategic and operational digital transformation goals.

Centric Software's laser focus on the fast-moving consumer goods sector for brands, retailers and manufacturers is clearly evident with its slate of complementary solutions to drive performance and profitability spanning retail planning, visual boards, competitive market intelligence, PLM and pricing & inventory optimization.

Research Director for Frost & Sullivan's industrial group, Karthik Sundaram, says, "The AI capabilities that are embedded across Centric Software's portfolio, demonstrate the tech-forward, innovative way of thinking that is a hallmark of the company. The different AI-powered solutions work in concert with each other, forming a seamless end-to-end product development flow that spurs efficiency for retailers, brands and manufacturers." Sundaram continues, "With its single taxonomy, the solutions provide Centric customers with accurate, data-based recommendations to yield high value and ROI. The specifics, like drilling down to product-level design, allocation and pricing data increase sell-through, speed time to market and maximize profit."

The Global Technology Innovation Leadership Award is given to a company for innovative products that gain rapid adoption in the market. The award recognizes the quality of the solutions and customer value enhancements the products enable.

"We are honored to be presented with the Global Technology Innovation Leadership Award. We are thrilled that Frost & Sullivan, a respected organization, has recognized our hard work and investment in innovations that give our customers a competitive advantage," says CEO of Centric Software, Chris Groves.

Learn more about Centric Software

See Centric AI-Powered Solutions in action at NRF2025, Booth #6257

Request a demo
